poem:
**The Quarry's Hidden Nightlife**

When dusk disguises the quarry's calm face,  
the hopeful creep of shadows unfurls.  
Beneath the swimmers' absent splashes,  
beneath the divers' vigilant gaze,  
the covert crustacean ventures forth,  
its journey unnoticed, a silent ballet  
among the echoing remnants of boats,  
where the sunken secrets whisper  
in the language of the unseen.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Country diary: A hopeful hunt for a covert crustacean | Derek Niemann When night falls over a drowned quarry, hope crawls out of despair. The human swimmers who play by day here, sploshing back and forth under sheer limestone walls, will not see it. Teams of wetsuited divers will not either, and they have other priorities. These divers go deep, sinking 25 metres to the rock bottom, where wheelhouse wrecks of boats are metal boxes". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
